method.name: GET
method.doc: Place Searches, which return a list of Places that are near a user's provided location.

param.name: output
param.doc: output may be either of the following values: json (recommended) indicates output in JavaScript Object Notation (JSON), xml indicates output as XML

param.name: key
param.doc: Your application's API key. This key identifies your application for purposes of quota management and so that Places added from your application are made immediately available to your app.

param.name: location
param.doc: The latitude/longitude around which to retrieve Place information. This must be specified as latitude,longitude.

param.name: radius
param.doc: The distance (in meters) within which to return Place results. The recommended best practice is to set radius based on the accuracy of the location signal as given by the location sensor. Note that setting a radius biases results to the indicated area, but may not fully restrict results to the specified area.

param.name: sensor
param.doc: Indicates whether or not the directions request comes from a device with a location sensor. This value must be either true or false.

param.name: keyword
param.doc: A term to be matched against all available fields, including but not limited to name, type, and address, as well as customer reviews and other third-party content

param.name: language
param.doc: The language in which to return results.

param.name: name
param.doc: A term to be matched against the names of Places. Results will be restricted to those containing the passed name value.

param.name: types
param.doc: Restricts the results to Places matching at least one of the specified types. Types should be separated with a pipe symbol (type1|type2|etc).

method.name: GET
method.doc: Once you have a reference from a Place Search request, you can request more details about a particular establishment or point of interest by initiating a Place Details request. A Place Details request returns more comprehensive information about the indicated place such as its complete address, phone number, user rating, etc.

param.name: output
param.doc: output may be either of the following values: json (recommended) indicates output in JavaScript Object Notation (JSON), xml indicates output as XML

param.name: key
param.doc: Your application's API key. This key identifies your application for purposes of quota management and so that Places added from your application are made immediately available to your app.

param.name: sensor
param.doc: Indicates whether or not the directions request comes from a device with a location sensor. This value must be either true or false.

param.name: reference
param.doc: A textual identifier that uniquely identifies a place, returned from a Place search request.

param.name: language
param.doc: The language in which to return results.
